skill.description: Use when reviewing code, PRs, or discussing code quality standards. Applies team coding standards and review methodology.

skill.author: ChaiWithJai

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only code review methodology and guidelines. All 19 static findings are false positives caused by keyword matching on legitimate code review documentation. No executable code, file access, network calls, or command execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Code reviews often lack structure, leading to inconsistent feedback and missed issues. This skill provides a systematic 3-pass review method with clear guidelines for giving constructive feedback.
actual_capabilities: Applies structured 3-pass review method (Understand, Correctness, Improvements)
Uses checklist-based approach for consistent bug and security detection
Guides constructive feedback with do and do-not examples
Limits review comments to focus on high-value feedback
Captures context about code changes (bug fix, feature, refactor)
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests automatically
Does not access external code review tools or platforms
Does not modify code or create pull requests
Does not integrate with CI/CD pipelines

use_cases.title: Review pull requests systematically
use_cases.description: Apply the 3-pass method to review PRs methodically and provide consistent, constructive feedback.

use_cases.title: Establish team review standards
use_cases.description: Define clear review guidelines and feedback expectations for consistent code quality across the team.

use_cases.title: Learn effective review techniques
use_cases.description: Follow structured methodology to understand how to review code and give helpful feedback.

prompt_templates.title: Quick code review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code for bugs, security issues, and readability. Use the 3-pass method: first understand what it does, then check correctness, then suggest improvements.

prompt_templates.title: PR feedback
prompt_templates.scenario: Give feedback on a pull request
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this pull request. Focus on the most important issues. Limit your comments to the top 5 problems. Be constructive and specific.

prompt_templates.title: Security review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code specifically for security issues. Look for injection risks, authentication problems, and data exposure. Explain each finding clearly.

prompt_templates.title: Pattern check
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code for consistency with existing patterns. Check naming conventions, function length, and error handling style. Suggest aligned improvements.

output: Pass 1 (Understand): This function processes user input and validates it against business rules
Pass 2 (Correctness): Found potential null reference on line 15; edge case for empty strings not handled
Pass 3 (Improvements): Consider extracting validation to a separate function for reusability; max 5 comments limit reached

output_examples.input: Review this PR for security issues
output: Critical: SQL injection risk on line 23 - user input not parameterized
High: Missing authentication check on API endpoint
Medium: Sensitive data logged in plain text

output_examples.input: Give feedback on my pull request
output: Great work on the clean error messages in the new validation function
Consider breaking down the large function (67 lines) into smaller helpers
Tests cover main cases but missing edge case for null input

best_practices: Use the 3-pass method: understand first, then check correctness, then suggest improvements
Limit comments to the top 5 issues to avoid overwhelming the author
Ask questions instead of giving commands to encourage collaboration
anti_patterns: Nitpicking style preferences instead of focusing on substantive issues
Being vague with feedback like this could be better
Using code reviews to show off knowledge or block progress

faq.question: What tools work with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It guides review conversations without needing direct tool integration.

faq.question: How many comments should I make?
faq.answer: Limit reviews to a maximum of 5 comments. Focus on the most important issues rather than exhaustively listing every problem.

faq.question: Can this run automated tests?
faq.answer: No, this skill does not execute code or run tests. It provides methodology and guidance for manual code review.

faq.question: Is my code safe to share?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill processes code within your conversation context. No code is sent to external services or stored externally.

faq.question: How is this different from linters?
faq.answer: Linters catch syntax and style issues automatically. This skill helps with higher-level concerns like architecture, logic bugs, and team knowledge sharing.

faq.question: Does this integrate with GitHub or GitLab?
faq.answer: No, this skill operates through conversation. You paste or describe code directly rather than connecting to review platforms.
